Some thoughts as we gear up for our first day of school...
Some things have changed that will never be the same, but, maybe they can be better!
The way you express how you feel about this school year is how your child will feel. Be excited! Be positive!
There will be trials and moments that truly test you. Breathe! Take a step back and focus on the things you have control over.
Reach out to your student‚Äôs team: teacher, principal, social worker and counselor. We are committed to making this the best year ever!
Look for the good! There is always good, even in the stormiest times.
Extend grace whenever possible. Our staff members truly want the best for all. They are human and are guaranteed to make mistakes.

This time will be whatever you make it. And in a blink, another year of your child‚Äôs life will be catalogued in a yearbook. Every day be sure to love, laugh, move, grow and be kind.

Hey 2020-21 school year: WE ARE COMING FOR YOU!!!

Participating in Saturday matches means getting on a bus, sometimes as early as 6:00 am. It means sometimes not arriving back to Columbian until 7:00 pm. Saturday matches sometimes pit you against some of the best players in the state of Ohio and even the country. Saturday matches mean becoming a better player and a better team. Saturday matches mean comradery and team building. Sometimes Saturdays can be silly, exhausting, exhilarating, heartbreaking, and triumphant.‚Ä¶

Mr. Hohman, currently the principal of an online public high school in Denver, climbed Denali in Alaska in 2008. Denali is the highest mountain peak in North America with a summit of over 20,000 feet above sea level. In his guest lecture today, Mr. Hohman made connections between his experience to the main character of Into the Wild, by Jon Krakauer, which the juniors are currently reading for English class. Juniors who were unable to attend can watch for the recorded version of the lecture from Mrs. Lewis.

The Columbian Quiz Bowl team had a great Saturday traveling to Pettisville to play in the 18 team tournament known as Petti-Warz III.

The varsity squad finished in a 3 way tie for 3rd with a 6-3 record. The team tied with Findlay and Maumee Valley Country Day. Troy, Michigan won the tournament with host Pettisville in second place.

Trevor Blodgett and Owen Thomsic lead the A team in scoring.

The B squad captured First Place in their 9 team division with a 6-2 record. They tied with Maumee Valley Country Day B team and the Goshen B team. Kelsie Weingart lead the B team in scoring.

Next up for the team will be the Mid-Ohio ESC spring tournament held in Mansfield on March 18.
